statutoryBodies.name: Nursing Homes Advisory Board
statutoryBodies.statusNote: Legislation not repealed, but no recent operational data or meeting records found. The Private Medical Institutions (Registration) Act, No. 21 of 2006 may have effectively superseded the regulatory function.

exOfficio.note: Chairman (S.9(1)); originally Director of Health Services, amended by No. 63 of 1988

nominated.role: Members appointed by Minister (3 from persons recommended by Independent Medical Practitioners' Association)
nominated.note: 2-year term; eligible for reappointment; Minister may remove (S.9(3))

nominated.role: Members appointed by Minister (at Minister's discretion)
nominated.note: 2-year term; eligible for reappointment; Minister may remove (S.9(3))

meetings.frequency: Not specified — Board sets own procedure (S.9(6))

powers: Advise the Minister upon matters affecting the administration of the Act (S.9(1))
Advise the Director upon the exercise of powers and functions conferred by the Act (S.9(1))
Regulate its own procedure unless regulations prescribe otherwise (S.9(6))
dataGaps: Relationship to Private Health Services Regulatory Council (est. 2007) unclear
Whether Board still convenes is unknown

amendments.summary: Significantly increased registration and renewal fees (e.g., from Rs. 100 to Rs. 10,000).
amendments.details: Endorsed 17 December 1988. Updated the fee schedule for nursing home registration and renewal, reflecting inflation since 1949. Source available from parliament.lk.

amendments.summary: Redefined the term "Director" to mean the Director-General of Teaching Hospitals.
amendments.details: Endorsed 17 December 1988. Changed the definition of "Director" in the interpretation section from Director of Health Services to Director-General of Teaching Hospitals, shifting regulatory authority for nursing homes. This affects the chairmanship of the Advisory Board (S.9) and all registration/inspection powers (S.2-6). Source available from parliament.lk.

timeline.details: Enacted as Act No. 16 of 1949, certified 26 March 1949. Provides for registration, regulation, supervision, and inspection of nursing homes. Establishes 7-member Nursing Homes Advisory Board.
Endorsed 17 December 1988. Significantly increased registration and renewal fees (e.g., from Rs. 100 to Rs. 10,000).
Endorsed 17 December 1988. Redefined "Director" to mean the Director-General of Teaching Hospitals, shifting regulatory authority away from the Director of Health Services.

tiers.name: Minister
tiers.relationship: Policy authority: makes regulations (S.7), appoints and removes Advisory Board members (S.9), may fix rates/fees/charges at nursing homes

tiers.name: Director-General of Teaching Hospitals
tiers.relationship: Registrar and regulator (originally Director of Health Services; amended by No. 63 of 1988): registers nursing homes (S.3), refuses/cancels registration (S.4), inspects premises (S.6), chairs Advisory Board (S.9)

tiers.name: Nursing Homes Advisory Board
tiers.relationship: Advisory role: advises Minister and Director on administration of the Act and exercise of powers (S.9)

tiers.name: Magistrate's Court
tiers.relationship: Appeals jurisdiction: hears appeals against refusal/cancellation of registration within 14 days; decision is final (S.5)

currentReplacement.national: Ministry of Health — policy oversight; Director of Health Services — registration and enforcement; Private Health Services Regulatory Council (est. 2007 under Act No. 21 of 2006) may have assumed regulatory functions
currentReplacement.provincial: Not applicable — Act operates at national level
